description: Irregular formation from Ancient Greek γυνή (gunḗ, “woman”) + -cide. Compare gynocide and gynecocide.

entries.meaning: The killing of females, especially female infants. [from 20th c.]
examples: The technology of sex preselection enables people, particularly men, to act on their biases against women; it is not an exaggeration to regard the potential results as a form of gynecide – that is, a wrongful form of sexual discrimination that reduces the relative number of females.
